H3389.def: = town, formerly referred to as {L:Salem<SDBH:שָׁלֵם>} and {L:Jebus<SDBH:יְבוּס>};◄ located on Mt. {L:Zion<SDBH:צִיֹּון>}; territory of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► conquered by king {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, who made it the capital of his kingdom

H8147.def: = state in which a countable entity is two in number

H7223.def: = state in which a countable entity is the first or the previous in a range

H2320.def: = period of time, measured by a complete cycle in the phases of the moon

H5265.def: = causative action by which humans remove an object from another object into which it had been inserted or attached in a different way

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H3389.def: = town, formerly referred to as {L:Salem<SDBH:שָׁלֵם>} and {L:Jebus<SDBH:יְבוּס>};◄ located on Mt. {L:Zion<SDBH:צִיֹּון>}; territory of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► conquered by king {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, who made it the capital of his kingdom

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H5337.def: = causative action by which humans remove an object from a situation where it could be damaged

H3709.def: = the inner part of the human {L:hand<SDBH:יָד>}, but with special focus on the activities performed with it, such as holding, covering, or lifting objects, leaning on a staff, clapping, etc.

H341.def: = state in which someone is engaged in a conflict with  someone else and acts accordingly

H693.def: = to go to a location where one will not be readily seen by others; ► and wait there for an opportunity to seize or attack someone or do something else that is supposed to be done when nobody else can witness it

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H3389.def: = town, formerly referred to as {L:Salem<SDBH:שָׁלֵם>} and {L:Jebus<SDBH:יְבוּס>};◄ located on Mt. {L:Zion<SDBH:צִיֹּון>}; territory of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► conquered by king {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, who made it the capital of his kingdom

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H7969.def: = state in which a countable entity is three in number

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H7243.def: = state in which a countable entity is the fourth in a range

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H8254.def: = action by which humans determine the weight of an object, which is usually done with the help of a balance (scales)

H3701.def: = silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins

H2091.def: = metal of a bright yellow color, ◄ found in rocks and alluvial deposits ► and used as a monetary standard and in jewellery and plating; ≈ associated with wealth, beauty, and prosperity

H3627.def: = human-made object of any kind, usually specified by the context, ◄ of various makings ► and made for various purposes

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H223.def: = man; ◄ {L:Hittite<SDBH:חִתִּי>}; ► warrior; husband of {L:Bathsheba<SDBH:בַּת־שֶׁבַע>}; killed on the authority of {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}

H3548.def: = person {L:ordained<SDBH:מלא>} and {L:consecrated<SDBH:קדשׁ>} to perform religious services on behalf of others

H499.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Aaron<SDBH:אַהֲרֹן>}; tribe of {L:Levi<SDBH:לֵוִי>}; ► high {L:priest<SDBH:כֹּהֵן>}

H6372.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Eleazar<SDBH:אֶלְעָזָר>}, high {L:priest<SDBH:כֹּהֵן>} during last phase of exodus; tribe of {L:Levi<SDBH:לֵוִי>}

H3881.def: = man and tribe; ◄ third son of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Leah<SDBH:לֵאָה>}; ► founder of one of the tribes of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}, later responsible for temple duties

H3107.def: = man, also known as {L:Zabad<SDBH:זָבָד>}; ► son of {L:Shimeath<SDBH:שִׁמְעָת>}, an {L:Ammonite<SDBH:עַמֹּונִי>} woman; ► he was a servant of {L:Joash<SDBH:יֹואָשׁ>}, king of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}, who murdered his master with the help of {L:Jehozabad<SDBH:יְהֹוזָבָד>}, son of {L:Shimrith<SDBH:שִׁמְרִית>}; both were later killed by {L:Joash<SDBH:יֹואָשׁ>}' successor {L:Amaziah<SDBH:אֲמַצְיָהוּ>}

H3442.def: = man; ◄ tribe of {L:Levi<SDBH:לֵוִי>}; ► family head in charge of a division of {L:priests<SDBH:כֹּהֵן>}; time of {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}

H5129.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Binnui<SDBH:בִּנּוּי>}; tribe of {L:Levi<SDBH:לֵוִי>}; ► Levite; after exile

H1131.def: = man; ► father of {L:Noadiah<SDBH:נֹועַדְיָה>}, Levite, after exile

H4557.def: = an oral or written account of something

H4948.def: = a measure of the heaviness of an object

H3789.def: = action by which humans or deities mark letters, words or other symbols on a surface, such as clay, stone, skin, or papyrus, usually with a pointed stylus or reed

H6256.def: = a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time

H1473.def: = causative action by which a group of people is forced to leave their country to settle somewhere else for an indefinite amount of time

H7126.def: = action by which humans or animals move to a location relatively close to the location in focus

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H8147.def: = state in which a countable entity is two in number

H6499.def: = young male bovine; ► clean, used as sacrifice; ≈ associated with power and strength, but also with violence and aggression and therefore often used to denote people who behave as such

H8673.def: = state in which a countable entity is nine in number

H8337.def: = state in which a countable entity is six in number

H352.def: = male herbivorous mammal with four legs; ◄ |iovis ladicaudata|i*, fat-tailed sheep; ► clean animal, used for sacrifice, source of meat, hides, wool, and horns; ≈ associated with strength and leadership

H7657.def: = state in which a countable entity is seven in number

H7651.def: = state in which a countable entity is seven in number

H3532.def: = young of a sheep, either male or female; ► eaten at Passover, and used for sacrifice; its fleece is used for clothing

H6842.def: = male domestic animal, generally black in color, found in both shorthaired and longhaired varieties, with horns, usually herded together with sheep; ◄ Capra hircus mambrica or Capra hircus angorensis; ► clean animal, source of milk, hides, hair, and horns, may be used for sacrifice; ≈ sometimes associated with demons, regarded as aggressive

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H1881.def: = a rule or directive made and maintained by someone in authority

H323.def: = person in charge of part of the Persian empire

H6346.def: = a regional governor within a larger kingdom, responsible for enforcing the law of the king, collecting taxes for the king, and leading regional armies

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
